intro: Stemmadenia mollis, commonly known as the soft-stemmed stemmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are clustered in inflorescences, making it an attractive plant for ornamental purposes.
